summary.span: 将文本表示为 UTF-16 代码单元的序列。

span.span: Represents text as a sequence of UTF-16 code units.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 字符串是用于表示文本的字符的有序集合。A string is a sequential collection of characters that is used to represent text. 对象是表示字符串 对象的有序集合。 对象对应于 UTF-16 代码单元。A object is a sequential collection of objects that represent a string; a object corresponds to a UTF-16 code unit. 对象的值是 对象的顺序集合的内容，并且该值是不可变的（即它是只读的）。The value of the object is the content of the sequential collection of objects, and that value is immutable (that is, it is read-only). 有关字符串不可变性的详细信息，请参阅本主题后面的 "不[可变性和 StringBuilder 类](#Immutability)" 一节。For more information about the immutability of strings, see the [Immutability and the StringBuilder class](#Immutability) section later in this topic. 内存中 对象的最大大小为2GB 或大约1000000000个字符。The maximum size of a object in memory is 2GB, or about 1 billion characters. 有关 Unicode、UTF-16、代码单位、代码点以及 和 类型的详细信息，请参阅[.net 中的字符编码简介](~/docs/dotnet/standard/base-types/character-encoding-introduction.md)。For more information about Unicode, UTF-16, code units, code points, and the and types, see [Introduction to character encoding in .NET](~/docs/dotnet/standard/base-types/character-encoding-introduction.md). 本部分内容：In this section: [实例化字符串对象](#Instantiation)[Instantiate a String object](#Instantiation)\ [Char 对象和 Unicode 字符](#Characters)[Char objects and Unicode characters](#Characters)\ [字符串和 Unicode 标准](#Unicode)[Strings and The Unicode Standard](#Unicode)\ [字符串和嵌入的 null 字符](#EmbeddedNulls)[Strings and embedded null characters](#EmbeddedNulls)\ [字符串和索引](#Indexes)[Strings and indexes](#Indexes)\ [空字符串和空字符串](#Nulls)[Null strings and empty strings](#Nulls)\ 不[可变性和 StringBuilder 类](#Immutability)[Immutability and the StringBuilder class](#Immutability)\ [序号与区分区域性的操作](#CultureSensitive)[Ordinal vs. culture-sensitive operations](#CultureSensitive)\ [规范化](#Normalization)[Normalization](#Normalization)\ [按类别列出的字符串操作String operations by category](#ByCategory) ## 实例化字符串对象Instantiate a String object 可以通过以下方式实例化 对象：You can instantiate a object in the following ways: - 通过将字符串文本赋给 变量。By assigning a string literal to a variable. 这是创建字符串时最常用的方法。This is the most commonly used method for creating a string. 下面的示例使用赋值创建几个字符串。The following example uses assignment to create several strings. 请注意， C#在中，由于反斜杠（\\）是一个转义字符，因此字符串中的文本反斜杠必须进行转义，或者必须 @-quoted整个字符串。Note that in C#, because the backslash (\\) is an escape character, literal backslashes in a string must be escaped or the entire string must be @-quoted. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class.Instantiate#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/cpp/string.instantiate1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp-interactive[System.String.Class.Instantiate#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/cs/program.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class.Instantiate#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/vb/instantiate1.vb#1)] - 通过调用 类构造函数。By calling a class constructor. 下面的示例通过调用多个类构造函数来实例化字符串。The following example instantiates strings by calling several class constructors. 请注意，一些构造函数包含指向字符数组的指针或作为参数的带符号字节数组。Note that some of the constructors include pointers to character arrays or signed byte arrays as parameters. Visual Basic 不支持对这些构造函数的调用。Visual Basic does not support calls to these constructors. 有关 构造函数的详细信息，请参阅 " 构造函数摘要"。For detailed information about constructors, see the constructor summary. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class.Instantiate#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/cpp/string.instantiate2.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Class.Instantiate#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/cs/program.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class.Instantiate#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/vb/instantiate1.vb#2)] - 通过使用字符串连接运算符（在 Visual Basic 中C#为 + in 和 & 或 +），可以从 实例和字符串文本的任意组合创建一个字符串。By using the string concatenation operator (+ in C# and & or + in Visual Basic) to create a single string from any combination of instances and string literals. 下面的示例演示如何使用字符串连接运算符。The following example illustrates the use of the string concatenation operator. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class.Instantiate#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/cpp/string.instantiate3.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp-interactive[System.String.Class.Instantiate#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/cs/program.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class.Instantiate#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/vb/instantiate1.vb#3)] - 通过检索属性或调用返回字符串的方法。By retrieving a property or calling a method that returns a string. 下面的示例使用 类的方法从较大的字符串中提取子字符串。The following example uses the methods of the class to extract a substring from a larger string. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class.Instantiate#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/cpp/string.instantiate3.cpp#4)] [!code-csharp-interactive[System.String.Class.Instantiate#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/cs/program.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class.Instantiate#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/vb/instantiate1.vb#4)] - 通过调用格式设置方法，将值或对象转换为其字符串表示形式。By calling a formatting method to convert a value or object to its string representation. 下面的示例使用[复合格式设置](/dotnet/standard/base-types/composite-formatting)功能将两个对象的字符串表示形式嵌入到一个字符串中。The following example uses the [composite formatting](/dotnet/standard/base-types/composite-formatting) feature to embed the string representation of two objects into a string. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class.Instantiate#5](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/cpp/string.instantiate3.cpp#5)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Class.Instantiate#5](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/cs/program.cs#5)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class.Instantiate#5](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.class.instantiate/vb/instantiate1.vb#5)] ## Char 对象和 Unicode 字符Char objects and Unicode characters 字符串中的每个字符都由一个 Unicode 标量值（也称为 Unicode 码位或 Unicode 字符的序号（数值）值）定义。Each character in a string is defined by a Unicode scalar value, also called a Unicode code point or the ordinal (numeric) value of the Unicode character. 每个码位都使用 UTF-16 编码进行编码，并且编码的每个元素的数值由一个 对象表示。Each code point is encoded by using UTF-16 encoding, and the numeric value of each element of the encoding is represented by a object. > [!NOTE] > 请注意，由于 实例包含 UTF-16 代码单元的有序集合，因此，可以创建一个不是格式正确的 Unicode 字符串的 对象。Note that, because a instance consists of a sequential collection of UTF-16 code units, it is possible to create a object that is not a well-formed Unicode string. 例如，可以创建具有低代理项的字符串，而无需使用相应的高代理项。For example, it is possible to create a string that has a low surrogate without a corresponding high surrogate. 尽管某些方法（如编码和解码 命名空间中的对象）可能会执行检查，以确保字符串格式正确， 类成员不确保字符串格式正确。Although some methods, such as the methods of encoding and decoding objects in the namespace, may performs checks to ensure that strings are well-formed, class members don't ensure that a string is well-formed. 单个 对象通常表示单个码位;也就是说， 的数值等于码位。A single object usually represents a single code point; that is, the numeric value of the equals the code point. 例如，字符 "a" 的码位为 U + 0061。For example, the code point for the character "a" is U+0061. 但是，码位可能需要多个编码元素（多个 对象）。However, a code point might require more than one encoded element (more than one object). Unicode 标准定义两种类型的字符，它们对应于多个 对象： graphemes，以及与 Unicode 补充平面中的字符相对应的 Unicode 补充码位。The Unicode standard defines two types of characters that correspond to multiple objects: graphemes, and Unicode supplementary code points that correspond to characters in the Unicode supplementary planes. - 字形由后跟一个或多个组合字符的基本字符表示。A grapheme is represented by a base character followed by one or more combining characters. 例如，字符ä由一个 对象表示，其码位为 U + 0061，后跟一个其码位为 U + 0308 的 对象。For example, the character ä is represented by a object whose code point is U+0061 followed by a object whose code point is U+0308. 此字符也可由00E4 的代码点为 U + 的单个 对象定义。This character can also be defined by a single object that has a code point of U+00E4. 如下面的示例所示，区分大小写的相等比较表明这两个表示形式相等，不过普通序号比较不是这样。As the following example shows, a culture-sensitive comparison for equality indicates that these two representations are equal, although an ordinary ordinal comparison does not. 但是，如果这两个字符串被规范化，则序号比较也指示它们相等。However, if the two strings are normalized, an ordinal comparison also indicates that they are equal. （有关规范化字符串的详细信息，请参阅[规范化](#Normalization)部分。）(For more information on normalizing strings, see the [Normalization](#Normalization) section.) [!code-cpp[System.String.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cpp/string.char1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cs/grapheme1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/grapheme1.vb#2)] - Unicode 补充码位（代理项对）由一个 对象表示，该对象的代码点为高代理项，后跟其代码点为低代理项的 对象。A Unicode supplementary code point (a surrogate pair) is represented by a object whose code point is a high surrogate followed by a object whose code point is a low surrogate. 高代理项的代码单位范围是从 U + D800 到 U + DBFF。The code units of high surrogates range from U+D800 to U+DBFF. 低代理项的代码单位范围是从 U + DC00 到 U + DFFF。The code units of low surrogates range from U+DC00 to U+DFFF. 代理项对用于表示16个 Unicode 补充平面中的字符。Surrogate pairs are used to represent characters in the 16 Unicode supplementary planes. 下面的示例创建一个代理项字符，并将其传递给 方法，以确定它是否为代理项对。The following example creates a surrogate character and passes it to the method to determine whether it is a surrogate pair. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cpp/string.char2.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp-interactive[System.String.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cs/surrogate1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/surrogate1.vb#3)] ## 字符串和 Unicode 标准Strings and the Unicode Standard 字符串中的字符由与 值相对应的 UTF-16 编码的代码单位表示。Characters in a string are represented by UTF-16 encoded code units, which correspond to values. 字符串中的每个字符都具有关联的 Unicode 字符类别，该类别在 .NET 中由 枚举表示。Each character in a string has an associated Unicode character category, which is represented in .NET by the enumeration. 可以通过调用 方法来确定字符或代理项对的类别。The category of a character or a surrogate pair can be determined by calling the method. [!INCLUDE[character-categories](~/includes/unicode-categories.md)] 此外，.NET 还支持基于 Unicode 标准的字符串比较和排序。In addition, .NET supports string comparison and sorting based on the Unicode standard. 在通过 [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)].NET Framework 版本中，.NET Framework 维护其自己的字符串数据表。In versions of the .NET Framework through the [!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)], the .NET Framework maintains its own table of string data. 这也适用于从 Windows 7 上运行的 [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] 开始 .NET Framework 版本。This is also true of versions of the .NET Framework starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] running on Windows 7. 从在 Windows 8 和更高版本的 Windows 操作系统上运行的 [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] 开始，运行时将字符串比较和排序操作委托给操作系统。Starting with the [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] running on Window 8 and later versions of the Windows operating system, the runtime delegates string comparison and sorting operations to the operating system. 在 .NET Core 中，字符串比较和排序信息由 Unicode 库的[国际化组件](http://site.icu-project.org/)提供。On .NET Core, string comparison and sorting information is provided by [International Components for Unicode](http://site.icu-project.org/) libraries. 下表列出了 .NET 版本以及 Unicode 标准的版本，这些版本的字符比较和排序基于这些版本。The following table lists the versions of .NET and the versions of the Unicode Standard on which character comparison and sorting are based. |.NET 版本.NET version|Unicode 标准版本Version of the Unicode Standard| |----------------------------|-------------------------------------| |[!INCLUDE[net_v11_long](~/includes/net-v11-long-md.md)]|[Unicode 标准，版本 4.0.0The Unicode Standard, Version 4.0.0](https://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode4.0.0/)| |.NET Framework 2.0.NET Framework 2.0|[Unicode 标准，版本 5.0.0The Unicode Standard, Version 5.0.0](https://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode5.0.0)| |[!INCLUDE[net_v35_long](~/includes/net-v35-long-md.md)]|[Unicode 标准，版本 5.0.0The Unicode Standard, Version 5.0.0](https://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode5.0.0)| |[!INCLUDE[net_v40_long](~/includes/net-v40-long-md.md)]|[Unicode 标准，版本 5.0.0The Unicode Standard, Version 5.0.0](https://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode5.0.0)| |Windows 7 [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] 及更高版本[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] and later on Windows 7|[Unicode 标准，版本 5.0.0The Unicode Standard, Version 5.0.0](https://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode5.0.0)| |Windows 8 及更高版本的 Windows 操作系统上的 [!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] 和更高版本[!INCLUDE[net_v45](~/includes/net-v45-md.md)] and later on Windows 8 and later Windows operating systems|[Unicode 标准，版本 6.3.0The Unicode Standard, Version 6.3.0](https://www.unicode.org/versions/Unicode6.3.0/)| |.NET Core（所有版本）.NET Core (all versions)|取决于基础操作系统支持的 Unicode 标准版本。Depends on the version of the Unicode Standard supported by the underlying operating system.| ## 字符串和嵌入的 null 字符Strings and embedded null characters 在 .NET 中， 对象可以包括嵌入的 null 字符，这些字符将作为字符串长度的一部分计数。In .NET, a object can include embedded null characters, which count as a part of the string's length. 但是，在某些语言（如 C 和C++）中，空字符表示字符串的末尾;它不被视为字符串的一部分，并且不计入字符串长度中。However, in some languages such as C and C++, a null character indicates the end of a string; it is not considered a part of the string and is not counted as part of the string's length. 这意味着，在应用到 对象时， C++ c 和编程人员或用 c C++编写的程序员或库可能会对字符串进行说明，这并不一定有效：This means that the following common assumptions that C and C++ programmers or libraries written in C or C++ might make about strings are not necessarily valid when applied to objects: - `strlen` 或 `wcslen` 函数返回的值不一定 相等。The value returned by the `strlen` or `wcslen` functions does not necessarily equal . - `strcpy_s` 或 `wcscpy_s` 函数创建的字符串不一定与 方法创建的字符串完全相同。The string created by the `strcpy_s` or `wcscpy_s` functions is not necessarily identical to the string created by the method. 你应确保用于实例化 C++对象的本机 C 和代码，以及通过平台调用传递 对象的代码，不会假定嵌入的 null 字符标记字符串的末尾。You should ensure that native C and C++ code that instantiates objects, and code that is passed objects through platform invoke, don't assume that an embedded null character marks the end of the string. 当对字符串进行排序（或比较）和搜索字符串时，字符串中嵌入的 null 字符也会以不同方式进行处理。Embedded null characters in a string are also treated differently when a string is sorted (or compared) and when a string is searched. 在两个字符串之间执行区分区域性的比较（包括使用固定区域性的比较）时，将忽略 Null 字符。Null characters are ignored when performing culture-sensitive comparisons between two strings, including comparisons using the invariant culture. 它们仅被视为顺序比较或不区分大小写的序号比较。They are considered only for ordinal or case-insensitive ordinal comparisons. 另一方面，在使用 、和 等方法搜索字符串时，始终会考虑嵌入的 null 字符。On the other hand, embedded null characters are always considered when searching a string with methods such as , , and . ## 字符串和索引Strings and indexes 索引是 中 对象（不是 Unicode 字符）的位置。An index is the position of a object (not a Unicode character) in a . 索引是从零开始的非负数字，从字符串中的第一个位置开始，即索引位置零。An index is a zero-based, nonnegative number that starts from the first position in the string, which is index position zero. 许多搜索方法（如 和 ）返回字符串实例中字符或子字符串的索引。A number of search methods, such as and , return the index of a character or substring in the string instance. 利用 属性，可以按字符串中的索引位置访问单个 对象。The property lets you access individual objects by their index position in the string. 由于 属性是默认属性（在 Visual Basic 中）或索引器（中C#为），因此可以通过使用如下所示的代码，访问字符串中的单个 对象。Because the property is the default property (in Visual Basic) or the indexer (in C#), you can access the individual objects in a string by using code such as the following. 此代码将查找字符串中的空格或标点字符，以确定字符串包含的单词数。This code looks for white space or punctuation characters in a string to determine how many words the string contains. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class#15](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cpp/string.stringbuilder1.cpp#15)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Class#15](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cs/immutable.cs#15)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#15](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/immutable.vb#15)] 对于对字符串的值进行多次更改的操作，可以使用 类，而不是 类。You can use the class instead of the class for operations that make multiple changes to the value of a string. 不同于 类的实例， 对象是可变的;当你连接、追加或删除字符串中的子字符串时，将对单个字符串执行这些操作。Unlike instances of the class, objects are mutable; when you concatenate, append, or delete substrings from a string, the operations are performed on a single string. 完成修改 对象的值后，可以调用其 方法将其转换为字符串。When you have finished modifying the value of a object, you can call its method to convert it to a string. 下面的示例将替换上一示例中使用的 ，以将范围内的1000随机字符串联为0x0001 到0x052F （使用 对象）。The following example replaces the used in the previous example to concatenate 1000 random characters in the range to 0x0001 to 0x052F with a object. 对象执行序号或区分区域性的（语言）操作。Members of the class perform either ordinal or culture-sensitive (linguistic) operations on a object. 序号运算作用于每个 对象的数值。An ordinal operation acts on the numeric value of each object. 区分区域性的操作将作用于 对象的值，并考虑特定于区域性的大小写、排序、格式设置和分析规则。A culture-sensitive operation acts on the value of the object, and takes culture-specific casing, sorting, formatting, and parsing rules into account. 在显式声明的区域性或隐式当前区域性的上下文中执行区分区域性的操作。Culture-sensitive operations execute in the context of an explicitly declared culture or the implicit current culture. 当在同一字符串中执行两种类型的操作时，它们会产生不同的结果。The two kinds of operations can produce very different results when they are performed on the same string. .NET 还支持不区分区域性的语言字符串操作（通过使用固定区域性（），这是松散的，这是基于英语独立于区域的区域性设置的。.NET also supports culture-insensitive linguistic string operations by using the invariant culture (), which is loosely based on the culture settings of the English language independent of region. 与其他 设置不同的是，固定区域性的设置在一台计算机、系统、系统和 .NET 版本之间保持一致。Unlike other settings, the settings of the invariant culture are guaranteed to remain consistent on a single computer, from system to system, and across versions of .NET. 固定区域性可被视为一种黑色框，可确保在所有区域性中进行字符串比较和排序的稳定性。The invariant culture can be seen as a kind of black box that ensures stability of string comparisons and ordering across all cultures. > [!IMPORTANT] > 如果你的应用程序对符号标识符（如文件名或命名管道）做出安全决策，或对保存的数据（例如 XML 文件中基于文本的数据）进行安全决策，则操作应使用序号比较，而不是区分区域性的比较。If your application makes a security decision about a symbolic identifier such as a file name or named pipe, or about persisted data such as the text-based data in an XML file, the operation should use an ordinal comparison instead of a culture-sensitive comparison. 这是因为区分区域性的比较可能会产生不同的结果，具体取决于有效的区域性，而序号比较仅依赖于所比较字符的二进制值。This is because a culture-sensitive comparison can yield different results depending on the culture in effect, whereas an ordinal comparison depends solely on the binary value of the compared characters. > [!IMPORTANT] > 执行字符串操作的大多数方法都包含一个重载，该重载的参数类型为 ，这使您能够指定方法是执行序号还是区分区域性的操作。Most methods that perform string operations include an overload that has a parameter of type , which enables you to specify whether the method performs an ordinal or culture-sensitive operation. 通常，应调用此重载，使方法调用的意图清晰明了。In general, you should call this overload to make the intent of your method call clear. 有关对字符串使用序号和区分区域性的操作的最佳实践和指南，请参阅[使用字符串的最佳做法](/dotnet/standard/base-types/best-practices-strings)。For best practices and guidance for using ordinal and culture-sensitive operations on strings, see [Best Practices for Using Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/best-practices-strings). 用于[大小写](#casing)、[分析和格式](#parsing)、[比较和排序](#comparison)的操作以及[相等性测试](#equality)的操作可以是序号或区分区域性的。Operations for [casing](#casing), [parsing and formatting](#parsing), [comparison and sorting](#comparison), and [testing for equality](#equality) can be either ordinal or culture-sensitive. 以下各节介绍操作的每个类别。The following sections discuss each category of operation. > [!TIP] > 应始终调用方法重载，使方法调用的意图清晰。You should always call a method overload that makes the intent of your method call clear. 例如，使用当前区域性的约定，而不是调用 方法来对两个字符串执行区分区域性的比较，应使用 `comparisonType` 参数的值 调用 方法。For example, instead of calling the method to perform a culture-sensitive comparison of two strings by using the conventions of the current culture, you should call the method with a value of for the `comparisonType` argument. 有关详细信息，请参阅[有关使用字符串的最佳实践](/dotnet/standard/base-types/best-practices-strings)。For more information, see [Best Practices for Using Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/best-practices-strings). 可以下载[排序权重表](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=10921)，这是一组文本文件，其中包含有关 Windows 操作系统排序和比较操作中所使用的字符权重的信息，也可以下载[默认 Unicode 排序元素表](https://www.unicode.org/Public/UCA/latest/allkeys.txt)，这是适用于 Linux 和 macOS 的排序权重表。You can download the [Sorting Weight Tables](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=10921), a set of text files that contain information on the character weights used in sorting and comparison operations for Windows operating systems, and the [Default Unicode Collation Element Table](https://www.unicode.org/Public/UCA/latest/allkeys.txt), the sort weight table for Linux and macOS. ### 大小写Casing 大小写规则确定如何更改 Unicode 字符的大小写;例如，从小写到大写。Casing rules determine how to change the capitalization of a Unicode character; for example, from lowercase to uppercase. 通常，大小写操作在字符串比较之前执行。Often, a casing operation is performed before a string comparison. 例如，可能会将字符串转换为大写形式，以便可以将其与另一个大写字符串进行比较。For example, a string might be converted to uppercase so that it can be compared with another uppercase string. 可以通过调用 或 方法将字符串中的字符转换为小写，并通过调用 或 方法将其转换为大写。You can convert the characters in a string to lowercase by calling the or method, and you can convert them to uppercase by calling the or method. 此外，还可以使用 方法将字符串转换为词首字母大写。In addition, you can use the method to convert a string to title case. [!INCLUDE[platform-note](~/includes/c-and-posix-cultures.md)] 大小写操作可以基于当前区域性的规则、指定的区域性或固定区域性。Casing operations can be based on the rules of the current culture, a specified culture, or the invariant culture. 由于大小写映射可能会因所使用的区域性而异，因此大小写操作的结果可能会因区域性而异。Because case mappings can vary depending on the culture used, the result of casing operations can vary based on culture. 大小写的实际差异为三种类型：The actual differences in casing are of three kinds: - 拉丁文大写字母 I （U + 0049）、拉丁文小写字母 I （U + 0069）、拉丁文大写字母 I 和以上点（U + 0130）和拉丁小写字母无点 I （U + 0131）之间的大小写区别。Differences in the case mapping of LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I (U+0049), LATIN SMALL LETTER I (U+0069), LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH DOT ABOVE (U+0130), and LATIN SMALL LETTER DOTLESS I (U+0131). 在 tr-TR （土耳其语（土耳其））和 az-Latn （阿塞拜疆，拉丁语）区域性中，在 tr、az 和 az-Latn 中立区域性中，与拉丁文大写字母 I 的小写等效项是拉丁语小写字母无点 I，而与上面带点的大写等效的大写字母 i 为拉丁文大写字母 I。In the tr-TR (Turkish (Turkey)) and az-Latn-AZ (Azerbaijan, Latin) cultures, and in the tr, az, and az-Latn neutral cultures, the lowercase equivalent of LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I is LATIN SMALL LETTER DOTLESS I, and the uppercase equivalent of LATIN SMALL LETTER I is LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH DOT ABOVE. 在所有其他区域性（包括固定区域性）中，拉丁文小写字母 I 和拉丁大写字母 I 是小写和大写等效项。In all other cultures, including the invariant culture, LATIN SMALL LETTER I and LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I are lowercase and uppercase equivalents. 下面的示例演示了在依赖于区分区域性的大小写比较的情况下，用于防止文件系统访问的字符串比较可能会失败。The following example demonstrates how a string comparison designed to prevent file system access can fail if it relies on a culture-sensitive casing comparison. （应使用固定区域性的大小写约定。）(The casing conventions of the invariant culture should have been used.) [!code-csharp[System.String.Class#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cs/case2.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/case2.vb#17)] - 固定区域性与所有其他区域性之间的大小写映射差异。Differences in case mappings between the invariant culture and all other cultures. 在这些情况下，使用固定区域性的大小写规则将字符更改为大写或小写将返回相同的字符。In these cases, using the casing rules of the invariant culture to change a character to uppercase or lowercase returns the same character. 对于所有其他区域性，它返回不同的字符。For all other cultures, it returns a different character. 下表列出了一些受影响的字符。Some of the affected characters are listed in the following table. |字符Character|如果更改为If changed to|返回Returns| |---------------|-------------------|-------------| |微米符号（U + 00B5）MICRON SIGN (U+00B5)|大写Uppercase|希腊文大写字母 MU （U +-39C）GREEK CAPITAL LETTER MU (U+-39C)| |拉丁文大写字母 I 替换为点（U + 0130）LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I WITH DOT ABOVE (U+0130)|小写Lowercase|拉丁文小写字母 I （U + 0069）LATIN SMALL LETTER I (U+0069)| |拉丁文小写字母无点 I （U + 0131）LATIN SMALL LETTER DOTLESS I (U+0131)|大写Uppercase|拉丁文大写字母 I （U + 0049）LATIN CAPITAL LETTER I (U+0049)| |拉丁文小写字母长 S （U + 017F）LATIN SMALL LETTER LONG S (U+017F)|大写Uppercase|拉丁文大写字母 S （U + 0053）LATIN CAPITAL LETTER S (U+0053)| |拉丁文大写字母 D 与小写字母 Z （U + 01C5）LATIN CAPITAL LETTER D WITH SMALL LETTER Z WITH CARON (U+01C5)|小写Lowercase|拉丁文小写字母 DZ WITH 抑扬符（U + 01C6）LATIN SMALL LETTER DZ WITH CARON (U+01C6)| |组合希腊语 YPOGEGRAMMENI （U + 0345）COMBINING GREEK YPOGEGRAMMENI (U+0345)|大写Uppercase|希腊语大写字母 IOTA （U + 0399）GREEK CAPITAL LETTER IOTA (U+0399)| - ASCII 字符范围内两个字母混合大小写对的大小写差异。Differences in case mappings of two-letter mixed-case pairs in the ASCII character range. 在大多数区域性中，两字母混合大小写与等效的双字母大写或小写对相等。In most cultures, a two-letter mixed-case pair is equal to the equivalent two-letter uppercase or lowercase pair. 对于以下区域性中的以下两个字母对，这并不是这样，因为在每种情况下，它们将与二个连字符进行比较：This is not true for the following two-letter pairs in the following cultures, because in each case they are compared to a digraph: - hr-HR （克罗地亚语（克罗地亚））区域性中的 "V6d-lj-h2e" 和 "nJ"。"lJ" and "nJ" in the hr-HR (Croatian (Croatia)) culture. - cs-CZ （捷克共和国）中的 "cH" 和 sk-SK （斯洛伐克语（斯洛伐克））区域性。"cH" in the cs-CZ (Czech (Czech Republic)) and sk-SK (Slovak (Slovakia)) cultures. - da-深色（丹麦语（丹麦））区域性中的 "aA"。"aA" in the da-DK (Danish (Denmark)) culture. - 按下的 "cS"、"dZ"、"dZS"、"nY"、"sZ"、"tY" 和 "zS"。"cS", "dZ", "dZS", "nY", "sZ", "tY", and "zS" in the hu-HU (Hungarian (Hungary)) culture. - es ES_tradnl （西班牙语（西班牙，传统排序））区域性中的 "cH" 和 "lL"。"cH" and "lL" in the es-ES_tradnl (Spanish (Spain, Traditional Sort)) culture. - vi-VN （越南语（越南））区域性中的 "cH"、"gI"、"kH"、"nG" "nH"、"pH"、"qU"、"tH" 和 "tR"。"cH", "gI", "kH", "nG" "nH", "pH", "qU', "tH", and "tR" in the vi-VN (Vietnamese (Vietnam)) culture. 但是，出现这种对等区分区域性的比较时可能会产生问题，因为这些对在固定字符串或标识符中不常见。However, it is unusual to encounter a situation in which a culture-sensitive comparison of these pairs creates problems, because these pairs are uncommon in fixed strings or identifiers. 下面的示例演示了在将字符串转换为大写时，区域性之间的大小写规则的一些差异。The following example illustrates some of the differences in casing rules between cultures when converting strings to uppercase. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cpp/string.casing.cpp#7)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cs/case1.cs#7)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#7](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/case1.vb#7)] ### 分析和格式化Parsing and formatting 格式设置和分析是反向操作。Formatting and parsing are inverse operations. 格式设置规则确定如何将值（如日期和时间或数字）转换为其字符串表示形式，而分析规则确定如何将字符串表示形式转换为值（如日期和时间）。Formatting rules determine how to convert a value, such as a date and time or a number, to its string representation, whereas parsing rules determine how to convert a string representation to a value such as a date and time. 格式设置和分析规则都依赖于区域性约定。Both formatting and parsing rules are dependent on cultural conventions. 下面的示例说明了解释特定于区域性的日期字符串时可能出现的多义性。The following example illustrates the ambiguity that can arise when interpreting a culture-specific date string. 如果不知道用于生成日期字符串的区域性约定，则不可能知道03/01/2011、3/1/2011 和01/03/2011 是表示年1月 2011 3 日还是年3月 2011 1 日。Without knowing the conventions of the culture that was used to produce a date string, it is not possible to know whether 03/01/2011, 3/1/2011, and 01/03/2011 represent January 3, 2011 or March 1, 2011. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class#8](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cpp/string.format1.cpp#8)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Class#8](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cs/format1.cs#8)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#8](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/format1.vb#8)] 同样，如下面的示例所示，单个字符串可以生成不同的日期，具体取决于在分析操作中使用约定的区域性。Similarly, as the following example shows, a single string can produce different dates depending on the culture whose conventions are used in the parsing operation. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class#9](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cpp/string.parse1.cpp#9)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Class#9](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cs/parse1.cs#9)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#9](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/parse1.vb#9)] ### 字符串比较和排序String comparison and sorting 用于比较和排序字符串的约定因区域性而异。Conventions for comparing and sorting strings vary from culture to culture. 例如，排序顺序可能基于拼音或字符的直观表示形式。For example, the sort order may be based on phonetics or on the visual representation of characters. 在东亚语言中，按文字的笔画和部首对字符进行排序。In East Asian languages, characters are sorted by the stroke and radical of ideographs. 排序也取决于字母表使用的排序语言和区域性。Sorting also depends on the order languages and cultures use for the alphabet. 例如，丹麦语包含一个 "Æ" 字符，该字符在字母表中的 "Z" 之后排序。For example, the Danish language has an "Æ" character that it sorts after "Z" in the alphabet. 此外，比较可以区分大小写或不区分大小写，在某些情况下，大小写规则也会因区域性而异。In addition, comparisons can be case-sensitive or case-insensitive, and in some cases casing rules also differ by culture. 另一方面，序号比较在比较和排序字符串时使用字符串中各个字符的 Unicode 码位。Ordinal comparison, on the other hand, uses the Unicode code points of individual characters in a string when comparing and sorting strings. 排序规则确定 Unicode 字符的字母顺序，以及两个字符串之间的相互比较。Sort rules determine the alphabetic order of Unicode characters and how two strings compare to each other. 例如， 方法基于 参数比较两个字符串。For example, the method compares two strings based on the parameter. 如果 参数值，则该方法将执行使用当前区域性的约定的语言比较;如果 参数值，则该方法将执行序号比较。If the parameter value is , the method performs a linguistic comparison that uses the conventions of the current culture; if the parameter value is , the method performs an ordinal comparison. 因此，正如下面的示例中所示，如果当前区域性为美国英语，则第一次调用 方法（使用区分区域性的比较）会将 "a" 视为 "a"，但对同一方法的第二次调用（使用序号比较）会将 "a" 视为大于 "A"。Consequently, as the following example shows, if the current culture is U.S. English, the first call to the method (using culture-sensitive comparison) considers "a" less than "A", but the second call to the same method (using ordinal comparison) considers "a" greater than "A". [!code-cpp[System.String.Class#10](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cpp/string.compare1.cpp#10)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/compare1.vb#10)] .NET 支持 word、string 和 ordinal 排序规则：.NET supports word, string, and ordinal sort rules: - 单词排序会对字符串执行区分区域性的比较，在这些字符串中，某些非字母数字的 Unicode 字符可能会分配有特殊的权重。A word sort performs a culture-sensitive comparison of strings in which certain nonalphanumeric Unicode characters might have special weights assigned to them. 例如，连字符（-）可能会分配非常小的权重，以便在排序列表中彼此相邻显示 "合作基金" 和 "共同操作"。For example, the hyphen (-) might have a very small weight assigned to it so that "coop" and "co-op" appear next to each other in a sorted list. 有关使用 word 排序规则比较两个字符串的 方法的列表，请参阅[按类别列出的字符串操作](#ByCategory)部分。For a list of the methods that compare two strings using word sort rules, see the [String operations by category](#ByCategory) section. - 字符串排序还会执行区分区域性的比较。A string sort also performs a culture-sensitive comparison. 它类似于单词排序，只不过没有特殊情况，所有非字母数字的符号都在所有字母数字 Unicode 字符之前。It is similar to a word sort, except that there are no special cases, and all nonalphanumeric symbols come before all alphanumeric Unicode characters. 可以使用字符串排序规则来比较两个字符串，方法是调用具有 `options` 参数的 方法重载，该参数提供 的值。Two strings can be compared using string sort rules by calling the method overloads that have an `options` parameter that is supplied a value of . 请注意，这是 .NET 提供的唯一方法，可使用字符串排序规则来比较两个字符串。Note that this is the only method that .NET provides to compare two strings using string sort rules. - 序号排序根据字符串中每个 对象的数值来比较字符串。An ordinal sort compares strings based on the numeric value of each object in the string. 序号比较会自动区分大小写，因为字符的小写和大写版本具有不同的码位。An ordinal comparison is automatically case-sensitive because the lowercase and uppercase versions of a character have different code points. 但是，如果 case 不重要，则可以指定忽略大小写的序号比较。However, if case is not important, you can specify an ordinal comparison that ignores case. 这等效于使用固定区域性将字符串转换为大写，然后对结果执行序号比较。This is equivalent to converting the string to uppercase by using the invariant culture and then performing an ordinal comparison on the result. 有关使用序号排序规则比较两个字符串的 方法的列表，请参阅[按类别列出的字符串操作](#ByCategory)部分。For a list of the methods that compare two strings using ordinal sort rules, see the [String operations by category](#ByCategory) section. 区分区域性的比较是指显式或隐式使用 对象的任何比较，包括 属性指定的固定区域性。A culture-sensitive comparison is any comparison that explicitly or implicitly uses a object, including the invariant culture that is specified by the property. 隐式区域性为当前区域性，由 和 属性指定。The implicit culture is the current culture, which is specified by the and properties. 字母字符的排序顺序（即， 属性在各个区域中为其返回 `true`）有相当大的差异。There is considerable variation in the sort order of alphabetic characters (that is, characters for which the property returns `true`) across cultures. 您可以通过将 对象提供给字符串比较方法（如 ）来指定使用特定区域性约定的区分区域性的比较。You can specify a culture-sensitive comparison that uses the conventions of a specific culture by supplying a object to a string comparison method such as . 您可以通过向 方法的适当重载提供除 或 之外的 枚举的 、或任何成员来指定区分区域性的比较。You can specify a culture-sensitive comparison that uses the conventions of the current culture by supplying , , or any member of the enumeration other than or to an appropriate overload of the method. 通常，区分区域性的比较适用于排序，而序号比较不是。A culture-sensitive comparison is generally appropriate for sorting whereas an ordinal comparison is not. 序号比较通常适用于确定两个字符串是否相等（即确定标识），而不是区分区域性的比较。An ordinal comparison is generally appropriate for determining whether two strings are equal (that is, for determining identity) whereas a culture-sensitive comparison is not. 下面的示例阐释区分区域性和顺序比较之间的差异。The following example illustrates the difference between culture-sensitive and ordinal comparison. 该示例计算三个字符串： "Apple"、"Æble" 和 "AEble"，使用序号比较和 "da-深色" 和 "en-us" 区域性的约定（每个字符串都是调用 方法时的默认区域性）。The example evaluates three strings, "Apple", "Æble", and "AEble", using ordinal comparison and the conventions of the da-DK and en-US cultures (each of which is the default culture at the time the method is called). 由于丹麦语将字符 "Æ" 视为单个字母，并在字母表中的 "Z" 后对其进行排序，因此字符串 "Æble" 大于 "Apple"。Because the Danish language treats the character "Æ" as an individual letter and sorts it after "Z" in the alphabet, the string "Æble" is greater than "Apple". 但是，"Æble" 不会视为等效于 "AEble"，因此 "Æble" 还会大于 "AEble"。However, "Æble" is not considered equivalent to "AEble", so "Æble" is also greater than "AEble". En-us 区域性不包含字母 "Æ"，而是将其视为等效于 "AE"，这说明 "Æble" 小于 "Apple" 但等于 "AEble" 的原因。The en-US culture doesn't include the letter"Æ" but treats it as equivalent to "AE", which explains why "Æble" is less than "Apple" but equal to "AEble". 另一方面，序号比较会将 "Apple" 视为小于 "Æble"，将 "Æble" 视为大于 "AEble"。Ordinal comparison, on the other hand, considers "Apple" to be less than "Æble", and "Æble" to be greater than "AEble". [!code-vb[System.String.Class#21](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/compare4.vb#21)] 使用以下一般准则来选择适当的排序或字符串比较方法：Use the following general guidelines to choose an appropriate sorting or string comparison method: - 如果希望根据用户的区域性对字符串进行排序，则应根据当前区域性的约定对它们进行排序。If you want the strings to be ordered based on the user's culture, you should order them based on the conventions of the current culture. 如果用户的区域性发生更改，则排序字符串的顺序也会相应地发生更改。If the user's culture changes, the order of sorted strings will also change accordingly. 例如，同义词库应用程序应始终基于用户的区域性对单词进行排序。For example, a thesaurus application should always sort words based on the user's culture. - 如果希望根据特定区域性的约定对字符串进行排序，则应通过将表示该区域性的 对象提供给比较方法进行排序。If you want the strings to be ordered based on the conventions of a specific culture, you should order them by supplying a object that represents that culture to a comparison method. 例如，在旨在向学生讲授特定语言的应用程序中，你希望根据使用该语言的某个区域性的约定对字符串进行排序。For example, in an application designed to teach students a particular language, you want strings to be ordered based on the conventions of one of the cultures that speaks that language. - 如果希望字符串顺序在不同的区域性中保持不变，则应根据固定区域性的约定或使用序号比较对它们进行排序。If you want the order of strings to remain unchanged across cultures, you should order them based on the conventions of the invariant culture or use an ordinal comparison. 例如，使用序号排序来组织文件、进程、互斥体或命名管道的名称。For example, you would use an ordinal sort to organize the names of files, processes, mutexes, or named pipes. - 对于涉及到安全决策（例如用户名是否有效）的比较，应始终通过调用 方法的重载来执行顺序相等性测试。For a comparison that involves a security decision (such as whether a username is valid), you should always perform an ordinal test for equality by calling an overload of the method. > word sort using the invariant culture, ordinal sort, and string sort using the invariant culture) without explicitly calling a string comparison method, although they do specify the type of comparison again. 请注意，最终排序顺序与使用 en-US 时的结果不一样，因为这次使用的是针对丹麦语（丹麦）的排序约定。Notice how the resulting sort order differs from the en-US results because it uses the sorting conventions for Danish (Denmark). [!code-csharp[Conceptual.Strings.Comparing#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/conceptual.strings.comparing/cs/sort1.cs#3)] [!code-vb[Conceptual.Strings.Comparing#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/conceptual.strings.comparing/vb/sort1.vb#3)] > [!WARNING] > 如果比较字符串的主要目的是确定它们是否相等，应调用 方法。If your primary purpose in comparing strings is to determine whether they are equal, you should call the method. 通常，应使用 来执行序号比较。Typically, you should use to perform an ordinal comparison. 方法主要用于对字符串进行排序。The method is intended primarily to sort strings. 字符串搜索方法（如 和 ）也可以执行区分区域性或序号的字符串比较。String search methods, such as and , also can perform culture-sensitive or ordinal string comparisons. 下面的示例使用 方法说明了序号和区分区域性的比较之间的差异。The following example illustrates the differences between ordinal and culture-sensitive comparisons using the method. 一个区分区域性的搜索，其中，当前区域性为英语（美国）会将子字符串 "oe" 视为匹配连字 "–"。A culture-sensitive search in which the current culture is English (United States) considers the substring "oe" to match the ligature "œ". 由于软连字符（U + 00AD）为零宽度字符，因此搜索会将软连字符视为等效于 ，并在字符串的开头找到匹配项。Because a soft hyphen (U+00AD) is a zero-width character, the search treats the soft hyphen as equivalent to and finds a match at the beginning of the string. 另一方面，序号搜索在任一情况下都找不到匹配项。An ordinal search, on the other hand, does not find a match in either case. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class#13](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cpp/string.compare3.cpp#13)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Class#13](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cs/compare3.cs#13)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#13](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/compare3.vb#13)] ### 搜索字符串Searching Strings 字符串搜索方法（如 和 ）也可以执行区分区域性或序号的字符串比较，以确定是否在指定字符串中找到了字符或子字符串。String search methods, such as and , also can perform culture-sensitive or ordinal string comparisons to determine whether a character or substring is found in a specified string. 类中搜索单个字符（如 方法或一组字符中的搜索方法，如 方法）的搜索方法都执行序号搜索。The search methods in the class that search for an individual character, such as the method, or one of a set of characters, such as the method, all perform an ordinal search. 若要对某个字符执行区分区域性的搜索，必须调用 方法，如 或 。To perform a culture-sensitive search for a character, you must call a method such as or . 请注意，使用序号和区分区域性的比较搜索字符的结果可能会有很大的不同。Note that the results of searching for a character using ordinal and culture-sensitive comparison can be very different. 例如，搜索预构成 Unicode 字符（如连字 "Æ" （U + 00C6））可能会根据区域性，以正确的顺序（例如 "AE" （U + 041U + 0045））匹配其所有组件。For example, a search for a precomposed Unicode character such as the ligature "Æ" (U+00C6) might match any occurrence of its components in the correct sequence, such as "AE" (U+041U+0045), depending on the culture. 下面的示例演示了在搜索单个字符时 和 方法之间的差异。The following example illustrates the difference between the and methods when searching for an individual character. 当使用 en-us 区域性的约定时，连字 "æ" （U + 00E6）在字符串 "高空" 中找到，但当使用的是 da-深色区域性或执行序号比较时，则不能使用。The ligature "æ" (U+00E6) is found in the string "aerial" when using the conventions of the en-US culture, but not when using the conventions of the da-DK culture or when performing an ordinal comparison. [!code-csharp[System.String.Class#22](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cs/search1.cs#22)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#22](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/search1.vb#22)] 另一方面，如果搜索选项未由类型 的参数明确指定，则 搜索字符串而不是字符的类方法将执行区分区域性的搜索。On the other hand, class methods that search for a string rather than a character perform a culture-sensitive search if search options are not explicitly specified by a parameter of type . 唯一的例外是 ，它执行序号搜索。The sole exception is , which performs an ordinal search. ### 测试是否相等Testing for equality 使用 方法来确定两个字符串在排序顺序中的关系。Use the method to determine the relationship of two strings in the sort order. 通常，这是一个区分区域性的操作。Typically, this is a culture-sensitive operation. 与此相反，请调用 方法来测试是否相等。In contrast, call the method to test for equality. 由于测试相等性通常会将用户输入与某个已知的字符串（如有效用户名、密码或文件系统路径）进行比较，因此通常为序号运算。Because the test for equality usually compares user input with some known string, such as a valid user name, a password, or a file system path, it is typically an ordinal operation. > [!WARNING] > 可以通过调用 方法，并确定返回值是否为零，来测试是否相等。It is possible to test for equality by calling the method and determining whether the return value is zero. 但是，不建议使用这种做法。However, this practice is not recommended. 若要确定两个字符串是否相等，应调用 方法的重载之一。To determine whether two strings are equal, you should call one of the overloads of the method. 要调用的首选重载是实例 方法或静态 方法，因为这两种方法都包含显式指定比较类型的 参数。The preferred overload to call is either the instance method or the static method, because both methods include a parameter that explicitly specifies the type of comparison. 下面的示例说明了在应改用序号时执行区分区域性比较是否相等的危险。The following example illustrates the danger of performing a culture-sensitive comparison for equality when an ordinal one should be used instead. 在这种情况下，代码的目的是禁止从以 "FILE://" 或 "file://" 开头的 url 进行文件系统访问，方法是对 URL 开头使用字符串 "FILE://" 执行不区分大小写的比较。In this case, the intent of the code is to prohibit file system access from URLs that begin with "FILE://" or "file://" by performing a case-insensitive comparison of the beginning of a URL with the string "FILE://". 但是，如果在以 "file://" 开头的 URL 上使用土耳其语（土耳其）区域性执行区分区域性的比较，则相等比较将失败，因为土耳其语大写字母等效于小写 "i" 而不是 "I"。However, if a culture-sensitive comparison is performed using the Turkish (Turkey) culture on a URL that begins with "file://", the comparison for equality fails, because the Turkish uppercase equivalent of the lowercase "i" is "İ" instead of "I". 因此，无意允许文件系统访问。As a result, file system access is inadvertently permitted. 另一方面，如果执行了序号比较，则相等比较将成功，并且拒绝文件系统访问。On the other hand, if an ordinal comparison is performed, the comparison for equality succeeds, and file system access is denied. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cpp/string.equals.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Class#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cs/equality1.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/equality1.vb#11)] ## 规范化Normalization 某些 Unicode 字符具有多个表示形式。Some Unicode characters have multiple representations. 例如，以下任何代码点都可以表示字母 "ắ"：For example, any of the following code points can represent the letter "ắ": - U+1EAFU+1EAF - U+0103 U+0301U+0103 U+0301 - U+0061 U+0306 U+0301U+0061 U+0306 U+0301 单个字符的多个表示形式使得搜索、排序、匹配和其他字符串操作复杂化。Multiple representations for a single character complicate searching, sorting, matching, and other string operations. Unicode 标准定义了一个名为规范化的进程，该进程为其任何等效的二进制表示形式返回 Unicode 字符的一个二进制表示形式。The Unicode standard defines a process called normalization that returns one binary representation of a Unicode character for any of its equivalent binary representations. 规范化可以使用多种算法，这些算法采用不同的规则。Normalization can use several algorithms, called normalization forms, that follow different rules. .NET 支持 Unicode 范式 C、D、GLM-KC-QNW 和 KD。.NET supports Unicode normalization forms C, D, KC, and KD. 将字符串规范化为同一范式后，可以使用序号比较对它们进行比较。When strings have been normalized to the same normalization form, they can be compared by using ordinal comparison. 序号比较是每个字符串中相应 对象的 Unicode 标量值的二进制比较。An ordinal comparison is a binary comparison of the Unicode scalar value of corresponding objects in each string. 类包括多个可执行序号比较的方法，其中包括：The class includes a number of methods that can perform an ordinal comparison, including the following: - 包含 参数 、、、、 和 方法的任何重载。Any overload of the , , , , , and methods that includes a parameter. 如果为此参数提供 或 的值，则方法会执行序号比较。The method performs an ordinal comparison if you supply a value of or for this parameter. - 方法的重载。The overloads of the method. - 默认情况下使用序号比较的方法，例如 、和 。Methods that use ordinal comparison by default, such as , , and . - 在字符串实例中搜索 值或 数组中的元素的方法。Methods that search for a value or for the elements in a array in a string instance. 此类方法包括 和 。Such methods include and . 可以通过调用 方法来确定字符串是否规范化为范式 C，也可以调用 方法来确定字符串是否规范化为指定的范式。You can determine whether a string is normalized to normalization form C by calling the method, or you can call the method to determine whether a string is normalized to a specified normalization form. 还可以调用 方法将字符串转换为范式 C，也可以调用 方法将字符串转换为指定的范式。You can also call the method to convert a string to normalization form C, or you can call the method to convert a string to a specified normalization form. 有关规范化和比较字符串的分步信息，请参阅 和 方法。For step-by-step information about normalizing and comparing strings, see the and methods. 以下简单示例演示了字符串规范化。The following simple example illustrates string normalization. 它在三个不同的字符串中以三种不同的方式定义字母 "ố"，并使用相等的序号比较来确定每个字符串与其他两个字符串不同。It defines the letter "ố" in three different ways in three different strings, and uses an ordinal comparison for equality to determine that each string differs from the other two strings. 然后，它将每个字符串转换为支持的范式，并再次对每个字符串采用指定范式的序号比较。It then converts each string to the supported normalization forms, and again performs an ordinal comparison of each string in a specified normalization form. 在每种情况下，第二个相等测试会显示字符串是否相等。In each case, the second test for equality shows that the strings are equal. [!code-cpp[System.String.Class#14](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cpp/string.normalize.cpp#14)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Class#14](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/cs/normalize1.cs#14)] [!code-vb[System.String.Class#14](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Class/vb/normalize1.vb#14)] 有关规范化和范式的详细信息，请参阅 ，以及[Unicode 标准附录 #15：](https://unicode.org/reports/tr15/) unicode.org 网站上的 unicode 范式和[规范化常见问题解答](https://www.unicode.org/faq/normalization.html)。For more information about normalization and normalization forms, see , as well as [Unicode Standard Annex #15: Unicode Normalization Forms](https://unicode.org/reports/tr15/) and the [Normalization FAQ](https://www.unicode.org/faq/normalization.html) on the unicode.org website. ## 按类别列出的字符串操作String operations by category 类提供成员，用于比较字符串，测试字符串是否相等，查找字符串中的字符或子字符串，修改字符串，从字符串中提取子字符串，组合字符串，格式化值，复制字符串，以及规范化字符串。The class provides members for comparing strings, testing strings for equality, finding characters or substrings in a string, modifying a string, extracting substrings from a string, combining strings, formatting values, copying a string, and normalizing a string. ### 比较字符串Comparing strings 您可以通过使用以下 方法来比较字符串，以确定它们在排序顺序中的相对位置：You can compare strings to determine their relative position in the sort order by using the following methods: - 返回一个整数，该整数指示在排序顺序中一个字符串与另一个字符串的关系。 returns an integer that indicates the relationship of one string to a second string in the sort order. - 返回一个整数，该整数指示一个字符串与另一个字符串的关系是否基于其码位的比较。 returns an integer that indicates the relationship of one string to a second string based on a comparison of their code points. - 返回一个整数，该整数指示当前字符串实例与排序顺序中的第二个字符串之间的关系。 returns an integer that indicates the relationship of the current string instance to a second string in the sort order. 方法为 类提供 和 实现。The method provides the and implementations for the class. ### 测试字符串是否相等Testing strings for equality 调用 方法来确定两个字符串是否相等。You call the method to determine whether two strings are equal. 实例 和静态 重载使你能够指定比较是区分区域性还是序号，以及是否考虑或忽略大小写。The instance and the static overloads let you specify whether the comparison is culture-sensitive or ordinal, and whether case is considered or ignored. 大多数相等测试都是序号，并且确定对系统资源（如文件系统对象）的访问权限的相等性比较应始终为序号。Most tests for equality are ordinal, and comparisons for equality that determine access to a system resource (such as a file system object) should always be ordinal. ### 查找字符串中的字符Finding characters in a string 类包括两种搜索方法：The class includes two kinds of search methods: - 返回一个 值以指示特定子字符串是否出现在字符串实例中的方法。Methods that return a value to indicate whether a particular substring is present in a string instance. 其中包括 、和 方法。These include the , , and methods. - 指示字符串实例中子字符串的起始位置的方法。Methods that indicate the starting position of a substring in a string instance. 其中包括 、、和 方法。These include the , , , and methods. > [!WARNING] > 如果要在字符串中搜索特定模式而不是特定子字符串，应使用正则表达式。If you want to search a string for a particular pattern rather than a specific substring, you should use regular expressions. 有关详细信息，请参阅[.Net 正则表达式](/dotnet/standard/base-types/regular-expressions)。For more information, see [.NET Regular Expressions](/dotnet/standard/base-types/regular-expressions). ### 修改字符串Modifying a string 类包括以下用于修改字符串值的方法：The class includes the following methods that appear to modify the value of a string: - 将字符串插入当前 实例。 inserts a string into the current instance. - 在字符串的开头插入指定字符的一个或多个匹配项。 inserts one or more occurrences of a specified character at the beginning of a string. - 在字符串的末尾插入指定字符的一个或多个匹配项。 inserts one or more occurrences of a specified character at the end of a string. - 删除当前 实例中的子字符串。 deletes a substring from the current instance. - 将子字符串替换为当前 实例中的另一个子字符串。 replaces a substring with another substring in the current instance. - 和 将字符串中的所有字符都转换为小写。 and convert all the characters in a string to lowercase. - 和 将字符串中的所有字符都转换为大写。 and convert all the characters in a string to uppercase. - 删除字符串开头和结尾的所有匹配项。 removes all occurrences of a character from the beginning and end of a string. - 删除字符串末尾的所有匹配项。 removes all occurrences of a character from the end of a string. - 从字符串的开头移除字符的所有匹配项。 removes all occurrences of a character from the beginning of a string. > [!IMPORTANT] > 所有字符串修改方法都将返回新的 对象。All string modification methods return a new object. 它们不会修改当前实例的值。They don't modify the value of the current instance. ### 从字符串中提取子字符串Extracting substrings from a string 方法将单个字符串分隔为多个字符串。The method separates a single string into multiple strings. 方法的重载允许您指定多个分隔符，以确定该方法提取的子字符串的最大数目，并确定是否在返回的字符串中包含空字符串（如果是相邻的分隔符，则会出现这种情况）。Overloads of the method allow you to specify multiple delimiters, to determine the maximum number of substrings that the method extracts, and to determine whether empty strings (which occur when delimiters are adjacent) are included among the returned strings. ### 组合字符串Combining strings 以下 方法可用于字符串串联：The following methods can be used for string concatenation: - 将一个或多个子字符串合并为一个字符串。 combines one or more substrings into a single string. - 将一个或多个子字符串连接到单个元素，并在每个子字符串之间添加分隔符。 concatenates one or more substrings into a single element and adds a separator between each substring. ### 格式设置值Formatting values 方法使用复合格式设置功能将字符串中的一个或多个占位符替换为一些对象或值的字符串表示形式。The method uses the composite formatting feature to replace one or more placeholders in a string with the string representation of some object or value. 方法通常用于执行以下操作：The method is often used to do the following: - 在字符串中嵌入数值的字符串表示形式。To embed the string representation of a numeric value in a string. - 在字符串中嵌入日期和时间值的字符串表示形式。To embed the string representation of a date and time value in a string. - 在字符串中嵌入枚举值的字符串表示形式。To embed the string representation of an enumeration value in a string. - 在字符串中嵌入支持 接口的某些对象的字符串表示形式。To embed the string representation of some object that supports the interface in a string. - 如果为，则在较大字符串中右对齐或左对齐字段中的子字符串。To right-justify or left-justify a substring in a field within a larger string. 有关格式化操作和示例的详细信息，请参阅 " 重载摘要"。For detailed information about formatting operations and examples, see the overload summary. ### 复制字符串Copying a string 您可以调用以下 方法来创建字符串的副本：You can call the following methods to make a copy of a string: - 返回对现有 对象的引用。 returns a reference to an existing object. - 创建现有字符串的副本。 creates a copy of an existing string. - 将字符串的一部分复制到字符数组中。 copies a portion of a string to a character array. ### 将字符串规范化Normalizing a string 在 Unicode 中，单个字符可以有多个码位。In Unicode, a single character can have multiple code points. 规范化将这些等效字符转换为相同的二进制表示形式。Normalization converts these equivalent characters into the same binary representation. 方法执行规范化，而 方法确定字符串是否规范化。The method performs the normalization, and the method determines whether a string is normalized. 有关详细信息和示例，请参阅本主题前面的[规范化](#Normalization)部分。For more information and an example, see the [Normalization](#Normalization) section earlier in this topic.

remarks.format:
## Remarks 本部分内容：In this section: [重载的构造函数语法](#Syntax)[Overloaded constructor syntax](#Syntax)\ [参数](#Params)[Parameters](#Params)\ [异常](#Exceptions)[Exceptions](#Exceptions)\ [我要调用哪种方法？](#Tasks)[Which method do I call?](#Tasks)\ [创建字符串](#Creating_Strings)[Creating strings](#Creating_Strings)\ [处理重复的字符串Handle repetitive strings](#Repetitive) 实例化字符串示例：Examples of instantiating strings: [使用字符串赋值](#Ctor1_Example)[Use string assignment](#Ctor1_Example)\ [使用字符数组](#Ctor2_Example)[Use a character array](#Ctor2_Example)\ [使用字符数组的一部分并重复使用单个字符](#Ctor3_Example)[Use a portion of a character array and repeating a single character](#Ctor3_Example)\ [使用指向字符数组的指针](#Ctor4_Example)[Use a pointer to a character array](#Ctor4_Example)\ [使用指针和数组范围](#Ctor5_Example)[Use a pointer and a range of an array](#Ctor5_Example)\ [使用指向有符号字节数组的指针](#Ctor6_Example)[Use a pointer to a signed byte array](#Ctor6_Example)\ [版本信息Version information](#Versions) ## 重载的构造函数语法Overloaded constructor syntax 字符串构造函数分为两类：不带指针参数的类，以及带有指针参数的构造函数。String constructors fall into two categories: those without pointer parameters, and those with pointer parameters. 使用指针的构造函数不符合 CLS。The constructors that use pointers are not CLS-compliant. 此外，Visual Basic 不支持使用指针，并且C#需要代码使用指针在不安全的上下文中运行。In addition, Visual Basic does not support the use of pointers, and C# requires code that uses pointers to run in an unsafe context. 有关详细信息，请参阅 [unsafe](/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/unsafe)。For more information, see [unsafe](/dotnet/csharp/language-reference/keywords/unsafe). 有关选择重载的其他指导，请参阅[应该调用哪种方法？](#Tasks)For additional guidance on choosing an overload, see [Which method do I call?](#Tasks) `String(Char[] value)` 将新的实例初始化为由 Unicode 字符数组指示的值。`String(Char[] value)` Initializes the new instance to the value indicated by an array of Unicode characters. 此构造函数复制 Unicode 字符（[示例](#Ctor2_Example)）。This constructor copies Unicode characters([example](#Ctor2_Example)). `String(Char[] value, Int32 startIndex, Int32 length)` 将新实例初始化为由 Unicode 字符数组指示的值、该数组内的起始字符位置和长度（[示例](#Ctor3_Example)）。`String(Char[] value, Int32 startIndex, Int32 length)` Initializes the new instance to the value indicated by an array of Unicode characters, a starting character position within that array, and a length ([example](#Ctor3_Example)). `String(Char c, Int32 count)` 将新的实例初始化为指定的 programmatically is simple assignment, as illustrated in [this example](#Ctor1_Example). 类还包括四种类型的构造函数重载，可让你从以下值创建字符串：The class also includes four types of constructor overloads that let you create strings from the following values: - 从字符数组（由 UTF-16 编码的字符组成的数组）。From a character array (an array of UTF-16-encoded characters). 您可以从整个数组或其中某个部分的字符创建新的 对象。You can create a new object from the characters in the entire array or a portion of it. 构造函数将数组中的所有字符复制到新字符串中。The constructor copies all the characters in the array to the new string. 构造函数将索引 `startIndex` 中的字符复制到索引 `startIndex` + `length`-1 到新字符串。The constructor copies the characters from index `startIndex` to index `startIndex` + `length` - 1 to the new string. 如果 `length` 为零，则 新字符串的值。If `length` is zero, the value of the new string is . 如果你的代码重复实例化具有相同值的字符串，则可以使用创建字符串的替代方法来提高应用程序性能。If your code repeatedly instantiates strings that have the same value, you can improve application performance by using an alternate means of creating strings. 有关详细信息，请参阅[处理重复的字符串](#Repetitive)。For more information, see [Handling repetitive strings](#Repetitive). - 使用 构造函数从零次、一次或多次重复的单个字符。From a single character that is duplicated zero, one, or more times, by using the constructor. 如果 `count` 为零，则 新字符串的值。If `count` is zero, the value of the new string is . - 通过使用 或 构造函数，从指向以 null 结尾的字符数组的指针。From a pointer to a null-terminated character array, by using the or constructor. 整个数组或指定范围可用于初始化字符串。Either the entire array or a specified range can be used to initialize the string. 构造函数从指定的指针或从指定的指针加 `startIndex`，然后继续到数组末尾或 `length` 字符，复制一系列 Unicode 字符。The constructor copies a sequence of Unicode characters starting from the specified pointer or from the specified pointer plus `startIndex` and continuing to the end of the array or for `length` characters. 如果 `value` 是 null 指针或 `length` 为零，则构造函数将创建一个其值 的字符串。If `value` is a null pointer or `length` is zero, the constructor creates a string whose value is . 如果复制操作继续到数组末尾，并且数组不是以 null 终止的，则构造函数行为与系统相关。If the copy operation proceeds to the end of the array and the array is not null-terminated, the constructor behavior is system-dependent. 这种情况可能导致访问冲突。Such a condition might cause an access violation. 如果数组包含任何嵌入的 null 字符（U + 0000 或 "\ 0"），并且调用了 重载，则字符串实例包含 `length` 个字符（包括任何嵌入的 null）。If the array contains any embedded null characters (U+0000 or '\0') and the overload is called, the string instance contains `length` characters including any embedded nulls. 下面的示例演示在将包含两个 null 字符的数组的指针传递到 方法时，将发生的情况。The following example shows what happens when a pointer to an array of 10 elements that includes two null characters is passed to the method. 由于地址是数组的开头，数组中的所有元素都将添加到字符串，因此构造函数将实例化包含10个字符的字符串，包括两个嵌入的 null。Because the address is the beginning of the array and all elements in the array are to be added to the string, the constructor instantiates a string with ten characters, including two embedded nulls. 另一方面，如果将同一个数组传递到 构造函数，则结果是一个四个字符的字符串，该字符串不包含第一个 null 字符。On the other hand, if the same array is passed to the constructor, the result is a four-character string that does not include the first null character. ，这意味着必须将字符数组定义为托管 [] 类型或非托管`wchar_t`[] 类型。In C++, this means that the character array must be defined either as the managed [] type or the unmanaged`wchar_t`[] type. 如果调用了 重载，且数组不是以 null 终止的，或者 重载 includes a range that it outside the memory allocated for the sequence of characters, the behavior of the constructor is system-dependent, and an access violation may occur. 此外，在 Intel Itanium 处理器上，对 signed byte array. 整个数组或指定范围可用于初始化字符串。Either the entire array or a specified range can be used to initialize the string. 可以使用默认代码页编码来解释字节序列，也可以在构造函数调用中指定编码。The sequence of bytes can be interpreted by using the default code page encoding, or an encoding can be specified in the constructor call. 如果构造函数尝试从整个数组中实例化一个非 null 终止的字符串，或者从 `value` + `startIndex` 到 `value` + `startIndex` + `length`-1 超出为数组分配的内存，则此构造函数的行为与系统相关，并可能会发生访问冲突。If the constructor tries to instantiate a string from an entire array that is not null-terminated, or if the range of the array from `value` + `startIndex` to `value` + `startIndex` + `length` -1 is outside of the memory allocated for the array, the behavior of this constructor is system-dependent, and an access violation may occur. 这三个构造函数将有符号字节数组作为参数，主要用于将C++ `char` 数组转换为字符串，如以下示例中所示：The three constructors that include a signed byte array as a parameter are designed primarily to convert a C++ `char` array to a string, as shown in this example: [!code-cpp[System.String.Ctor#4](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.ctor/cpp/sbyte_ctor1.cpp#4)] 如果数组包含任何 null 字符（"\ 0"）或其值为0的字节，并且调用了 重载，则字符串实例包含 `length` 个字符（包括任何嵌入的 null）。If the array contains any null characters ('\0') or bytes whose value is 0 and the overload is called, the string instance contains `length` characters including any embedded nulls. 由于地址是数组的开头，数组中的所有元素都将添加到字符串，因此构造函数将实例化包含10个字符的字符串，包括两个嵌入的 null。Because the address is the beginning of the array and all elements in the array are to be added to the string, the constructor instantiates a string with ten characters, including two embedded nulls. 另一方面，如果将同一个数组传递到 构造函数，则结果是一个四个字符的字符串，该字符串不包含第一个 null 字符。On the other hand, if the same array is passed to the constructor, the result is a four-character string that does not include the first null character. [!code-cpp[System.String.ctor#6](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.ctor/cpp/ptrctor_null.cpp#6)] [!code-csharp[System.String.ctor#6](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.ctor/cs/ptrctor_null.cs#6)] 由于 和 构造函数使用默认的 ANSI 代码页来解释 `value`，因此使用相同的字节数组调用这些构造函数可能会在不同系统上创建具有不同值的字符串。Because the and constructors interpret `value` by using the default ANSI code page, calling these constructors with identical byte arrays may create strings that have different values on different systems. ## 处理重复的字符串Handle repetitive strings 分析或解码文本流的应用通常使用 构造函数或 方法将字符序列转换为字符串。Apps that parse or decode streams of text often use the constructor or the method to convert sequences of characters into a string. 重复创建具有相同值的新字符串，而不是创建和重用一个字符串会浪费内存。Repeatedly creating new strings with the same value instead of creating and reusing one string wastes memory. 如果你可能通过调用 构造函数来重复创建相同的字符串值，即使你事先不知道这些相同的字符串值可能是什么，也可以改用查找表。If you are likely to create the same string value repeatedly by calling the constructor, even if you don't know in advance what those identical string values may be, you can use a lookup table instead. 例如，假设您从包含 XML 标记和特性的文件中读取和分析字符流。For example, suppose you read and parse a stream of characters from a file that contains XML tags and attributes. 分析流时，重复遇到某些标记（即，具有符号含义的字符序列）。When you parse the stream, you repeatedly encounter certain tokens (that is, sequences of characters that have a symbolic meaning). 与字符串 "0"、"1"、"true" 和 "false" 等效的标记可能经常出现在 XML 流中。Tokens equivalent to the strings "0", "1", "true", and "false" are likely to occur frequently in an XML stream. 无需将每个标记转换为新字符串，只需创建一个 对象即可保存通常出现的字符串。Instead of converting each token into a new string, you can create a object to hold commonly occurring strings. 对象可提高性能，因为它检索存储的字符串，而不分配临时内存。The object improves performance, because it retrieves stored strings without allocating temporary memory. 如果遇到标记，请使用 方法从表中检索标记。When you encounter a token, use the method to retrieve the token from the table. 如果标记存在，则方法返回相应的字符串。If the token exists, the method returns the corresponding string. 如果该标记不存在，请使用 方法将标记插入到表中，并获取相应的字符串。If the token does not exist, use the method to insert the token into the table and to get the corresponding string. ## 示例1：使用字符串赋值Example 1: Use string assignment 下面的示例通过为字符串赋值来创建一个新字符串。The following example creates a new string by assigning it a string literal. 它通过将第一个字符串的值分配给它来创建第二个字符串。It creates a second string by assigning the value of the first string to it. 这是实例化新的 对象的两种最常见的方法。These are the two most common ways to instantiate a new object. [!code-cpp[System.String.ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.ctor/cpp/assignment.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.String.ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.ctor/cs/ctor1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.String.ctor#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.ctor/vb/ctor1.vb#1)] ## 示例2：使用字符数组Example 2: Use a character array 下面的示例演示如何从字符数组创建新的 对象。The following example demonstrates how to create a new object from a character array. [!code-cpp[stringexample1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/stringexample1/CPP/source.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[stringexample1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/stringexample1/CS/source.cs#1)] [!code-vb[stringexample1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/stringexample1/VB/source.vb#1)] ## 示例3：使用字符数组的一部分并重复单个字符Example 3: Use a portion of a character array and repeating a single character 下面的示例演示如何从字符数组的一部分创建新的 对象，以及如何创建一个包含多个单个字符出现的新 对象。The following example demonstrates how to create a new object from a portion of a character array, and how to create a new object that contains multiple occurrences of a single character. [!code-cpp[stringexample1#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/stringexample1/CPP/source.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[stringexample1#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/stringexample1/CS/source.cs#3)] [!code-vb[stringexample1#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/stringexample1/VB/source.vb#3)] ## 示例4：使用指向字符数组的指针Example 4: Use a pointer to a character array 下面的示例演示如何从指向字符数组的指针创建新的 对象。The following example demonstrates how to create a new object from a pointer to an array of characters. 必须C#使用 `/unsafe` 编译器开关编译该示例。The C# example must be compiled by using the `/unsafe` compiler switch. [!code-cpp[System.String.Ctor#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.ctor/cpp/char1_ctor.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Ctor#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.ctor/cs/ctor2.cs#2)] ## 示例5：从指针和数组的范围实例化字符串Example 5: Instantiate a string from a pointer and a range of an array 下面的示例检查某个字符数组的元素中是否有句点或感叹号。The following example examines the elements of a character array for either a period or an exclamation point. 如果找到了一个字符串，则会从该标点符号前面的数组中的字符实例化一个字符串。If one is found, it instantiates a string from the characters in the array that precede the punctuation symbol. 如果不是，则会实例化包含数组全部内容的字符串。If not, it instantiates a string with the entire contents of the array. 必须C#使用 `/unsafe` 编译器开关编译该示例。The C# example must be compiled using the `/unsafe` compiler switch. [!code-cpp[System.String.Ctor#3](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.ctor/cpp/char2_ctor.cpp#3)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Ctor#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.ctor/cs/char2_ctor.cs#3)] ## 示例6：从指向有符号字节数组的指针实例化字符串Example 6: Instantiate a string from a pointer to a signed byte array 下面的示例演示如何使用 构造函数创建 类的实例。The following example demonstrates how you can create an instance of the class with the constructor. remarks.format: ## Remarks `index` 参数是从零开始的。The `index` parameter is zero-based. 此属性返回 `index` 参数所指定位置处的 对象。This property returns the object at the position specified by the `index` parameter. 但是，Unicode 字符可能由多个 表示。However, a Unicode character might be represented by more than one . 使用 类来处理 Unicode 字符，而不是 对象。Use the class to work with Unicode characters instead of objects. 有关详细信息，请参阅 类概述中的 "Char 对象和 Unicode 字符" 一节。For more information, see the "Char Objects and Unicode Characters" section in the class overview. 在C#中， 属性为索引器。In C#, the property is an indexer. 在 Visual Basic 中，它是 类的默认属性。In Visual Basic, it is the default property of the class. 字符串中的每个 对象都可以通过使用如下所示的代码进行访问。Each object in the string can be accessed by using code such as the following. :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.chars/cs/chars1.cs" interactive="try-dotnet-method" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.string.chars/vb/chars1.vb" id="Snippet1"::: ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何在例程中使用此索引器来验证字符串。The following example demonstrates how you can use this indexer in a routine to validate a string. :::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Uri_IsHexDigit/CPP/uri_ishexdigit.cpp" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/Uri_IsHexDigit/CS/uri_ishexdigit.cs" id="Snippet1"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/Uri_IsHexDigit/VB/uri_ishexdigit.vb" id="Snippet1":::

remarks.format: ## Remarks 返回值不是此实例的独立副本;它只是相同数据的另一个视图。The return value is not an independent copy of this instance; it is simply another view of the same data. 使用 或 方法来创建一个与此实例具有相同值的单独 对象。Use the or method to create a separate object with the same value as this instance. 由于 方法只是返回现有的字符串实例，因此很少需要直接调用它。Because the method simply returns the existing string instance, there is little reason to call it directly.

summary.span: 比较两个指定的 对象，并返回一个指示二者在排序顺序中的相对位置的整数。

span.span: Compares two specified objects and returns an integer that indicates their relative position in the sort order.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法的所有重载返回一个 32 位有符号整数，指示两个比较数之间的词法关系。All overloads of the method return a 32-bit signed integer indicating the lexical relationship between the two comparands. |值Value|条件Condition| |-----------|---------------| |小于零Less than zero|在排序顺序中，第一个子字符串在第二个子字符串之前。The first substring precedes the second substring in the sort order.| |零Zero|子字符串在排序顺序中出现的位置相同或 `length` 为零。The substrings occur in the same position in the sort order, or `length` is zero.| |大于零Greater than zero|第一个子字符串在排序顺序中后跟第二个子字符串。The first substring follows the second substring in the sort order.| > [!WARNING] > 应尽可能调用包含 参数的 方法的重载。Whenever possible, you should call an overload of the method that includes a parameter. 有关详细信息，请参阅[有关使用字符串的最佳实践](/dotnet/standard/base-types/best-practices-strings)。For more information, see [Best Practices for Using Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/best-practices-strings).

related.span: 有关使用 .NET 中字符串的最佳做法

span.span: Best Practices for Using Strings in .NET

remarks.format: ## Remarks 比较使用当前区域性来获取特定于区域性的信息，如大小写规则和单个字符的字母顺序。The comparison uses the current culture to obtain culture-specific information such as casing rules and the alphabetic order of individual characters. 例如，区域性可以指定将某些字符组合视为单个字符，或以特定方式比较大写和小写字符，或字符的排序顺序取决于其前面或后面的字符。For example, a culture could specify that certain combinations of characters be treated as a single character, or uppercase and lowercase characters be compared in a particular way, or that the sorting order of a character depends on the characters that precede or follow it. 使用字词排序规则执行比较。The comparison is performed using word sort rules. 有关 word、字符串和序号排序的详细信息，请参阅 。For more information about word, string, and ordinal sorts, see . > [!WARNING] > 在比较字符串时，应调用 方法，这要求您显式指定方法使用的字符串比较的类型。When comparing strings, you should call the method, which requires that you explicitly specify the type of string comparison that the method uses. 有关详细信息，请参阅[有关使用字符串的最佳实践](/dotnet/standard/base-types/best-practices-strings)。For more information, see [Best Practices for Using Strings](/dotnet/standard/base-types/best-practices-strings). 可以 `null`其中一个或两个比较比较。One or both comparands can be `null`. 按照定义，包含空字符串（""）的任何字符串比较大于空引用;和两个 null 引用的比较结果相等。By definition, any string, including the empty string (""), compares greater than a null reference; and two null references compare equal to each other. 当发现不相等或已比较两个字符串时，将终止比较。The comparison terminates when an inequality is discovered or both strings have been compared. 但是，如果两个字符串的比较结果等于一个字符串的末尾，而另一个字符串还剩个字符，则包含剩余字符的字符串将被视为更大的字符串。However, if the two strings compare equal to the end of one string, and the other string has characters remaining, then the string with remaining characters is considered greater. 返回值是执行的最后一次比较的结果。The return value is the result of the last comparison performed. 当比较受区域性特定的大小写规则影响时，可能会出现意外的结果。Unexpected results can occur when comparisons are affected by culture-specific casing rules. 例如，在土耳其语中，以下示例产生了错误的结果，因为土耳其语中的文件系统不会将语言大小写规则用于 "file" 中的字母 "i"。For example, in Turkish, the following example yields the wrong results because the file system in Turkish does not use linguistic casing rules for the letter "i" in "file". [!code-cpp[System.String.Compare#10](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/cpp/remarks.cpp#10)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Compare#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/cs/remarks.cs#10)] [!code-vb[System.String.Compare#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/vb/remarks.vb#10)] 使用序号比较将路径名称与 "file" 进行比较。Compare the path name to "file" using an ordinal comparison. 要执行此操作，正确的代码如下所示：The correct code to do this is as follows: [!code-cpp[System.String.Compare#11](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/cpp/remarks.cpp#11)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Compare#11](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/cs/remarks.cs#11)] [!code-vb[System.String.Compare#11](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/vb/remarks.vb#11)] ## Examples 下面的示例调用 方法来比较三组字符串。The following example calls the method to compare three sets of strings. [!code-cpp[System.String.Compare#18](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/cpp/compare02.cpp#18)] [!code-csharp-interactive[System.String.Compare#18](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/cs/compare02.cs#18)] [!code-vb[System.String.Compare#18](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/vb/compare02.vb#18)] 在下面的示例中，`ReverseStringComparer` 类演示了如何用 方法来计算两个字符串。In the following example, the `ReverseStringComparer` class demonstrates how you can evaluate two strings with the method. :::code language="cpp" source="~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/ArrayList/CPP/ArrayListSample.cpp" id="Snippet7"::: :::code language="csharp" source="~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/ArrayList/CS/ArrayListSample.cs" interactive="try-dotnet" id="Snippet7"::: :::code language="vb" source="~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/ArrayList/VB/ArrayListSample.vb" id="Snippet7":::

para.span: 例如，如果以下代码在 [!INCLUDE[netfx40_short](~/includes/netfx40-short-md.md)] 或更高版本上运行，则使用 "ani" （软连字符或 U + 00AD）的 "动物" 比较区分区域性的 "动物" 比较（使用软连字符或 U +）表示这两个字符串是等效的。

span.span: For example, if the following code is run on the [!INCLUDE[netfx40_short](~/includes/netfx40-short-md.md)] or later, a culture-sensitive comparison of "animal" with "ani-mal" (using a soft hyphen, or U+00AD) indicates that the two strings are equivalent.

remarks.format: ## Remarks `comparisonType` 参数指示比较应使用当前区域性或固定区域性，是遵循还是忽略比较规则的大小写，或者使用 word （区分区域性）或序号（不区分区域性）排序规则。The `comparisonType` parameter indicates whether the comparison should use the current or invariant culture, honor or ignore the case of the comparands, or use word (culture-sensitive) or ordinal (culture-insensitive) sort rules. 可以 `null`其中一个或两个比较比较。One or both comparands can be `null`. 按照定义，包含空字符串（""）的任何字符串比较大于空引用;和两个 null 引用的比较结果相等。By definition, any string, including the empty string (""), compares greater than a null reference; and two null references compare equal to each other. 当发现不相等或已比较两个字符串时，将终止比较。The comparison terminates when an inequality is discovered or both strings have been compared. 但是，如果两个字符串的比较结果等于一个字符串的末尾，而另一个字符串还剩个字符，则包含剩余字符的字符串将被视为更大的字符串。However, if the two strings compare equal to the end of one string, and the other string has characters remaining, the string with remaining characters is considered greater. 返回值是执行的最后一次比较的结果。The return value is the result of the last comparison performed. 当比较受区域性特定的大小写规则影响时，可能会出现意外的结果。Unexpected results can occur when comparisons are affected by culture-specific casing rules. 例如，在土耳其语中，以下示例产生了错误的结果，因为土耳其语中的文件系统不会将语言大小写规则用于 "file" 中的字母 "i"。For example, in Turkish, the following example yields the wrong results because the file system in Turkish does not use linguistic casing rules for the letter "i" in "file". [!code-cpp[System.String.Compare#16](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/cpp/remarks.cpp#16)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Compare#16](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/cs/remarks.cs#16)] [!code-vb[System.String.Compare#16](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/vb/remarks.vb#16)] 使用序号比较将路径名称与 "file" 进行比较。Compare the path name to "file" using an ordinal comparison. 要执行此操作，正确的代码如下所示：The correct code to do this is as follows: [!code-cpp[System.String.Compare#17](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/cpp/remarks.cpp#17)] [!code-csharp[System.String.Compare#17](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/cs/remarks.cs#17)] [!code-vb[System.String.Compare#17](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.Compare/vb/remarks.vb#17)] ## Examples 下面的示例比较字母 "I" 的三个版本。The following example compares three versions of the letter "I". 结果受区域性选择的影响，是否忽略大小写，以及是否执行序号比较。The results are affected by the choice of culture, whether case is ignored, and whether an ordinal comparison is performed. [!code-cpp[System.String.CompareCmp#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.CompareCmp/cpp/cmpcmp.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.String.CompareCmp#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.CompareCmp/cs/cmpcmp.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.String.CompareCmp#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.String.CompareCmp/vb/cmpcmp.vb#1)]
